title.narrative: RS! Indonesia - Cotton and Textile

description.narrative: This project is part of RECLAIM Sustainability! Consortium, which aims to reclaim the essence of sustainability by building an enabling environment for farmers and workers to have equal position with other stakeholders in the supply chain. Reclaim Sustainability! Project in textile sector in Indonesia is to increase stakeholders' participation, including employees and labours, to improve working condition in textile industry.

title.narrative: Civil Society is involved in participatory decision making processes related to sustainable supply chains (OUTPUT)
# and type of Civil Society actors and target groups supported

comment.narrative: 1) Solidaridad Indonesia has collaboration with PBI (Perserikatan Bumdesa Indonesia)

title.narrative: Governments at global, regional, national, local level implement and enforce mandatory sustainability frameworks (OUTPUT)
# and qualitative description of governmental and private policies for sustainable production, trade and consumption influenced

comment.narrative: 1) Solidaridad Indonesia has influenced 1 policy on CSR funding implementation , while for BWI the process of the lobby and advocacy still at the level raising awareness of government and private sector by providing research report, book and brief paper on sustainable textilles.

title.narrative: Corporates implement sustainability policies (OUTPUT)
# of tools and business models developed and being tested for sourcing, production, trade and investment

comment.narrative: A simple media to increase access of information for women workers is developed, namely "PerempuanBekerja", in social media

title.narrative: Citizens raise their voice (OUTPUT)
# of CSO led awareness raising campaigns

comment.narrative: During year 1, is approaching, building communication and strengthening the skill of CSO while also improve their point of view on how important is the role of CSO to speak up.

title.narrative: Corporates implement sustainability policies (OUTPUT)
# of other non private sector partners (knowledge, public, CSOs, others) engaged in co-design, test and promote new tools or business models for sourcing, production, trade and investment

comment.narrative: Faculty of Social and Political Science. University of Atmajaya Yogyakarta

title.narrative: Governments at global, regional, national, local level implement and enforce mandatory sustainability frameworks (OUTPUT)
# of dialogues initiated, strengthened or joined to engage Civil Society and Civil Society's agenda in debate with public and private decision makers

comment.narrative: In year 1, started with dialouge to develop engagement and collaboration with API (Indonesian Textiles Association) Central Java Province in order to strengthen the agenda for advocacy, to understand and discuss the point of view private sector related some challenges toward sustainable textiles sector.

title.narrative: Civil Society is involved in participatory decision making processes related to sustainable supply chains
# Civil Society actors and target groups with increased L&A capacities

comment.narrative: Still in the process of increasing skill of lobby and advocacy of the targetted CSOs. In this stage, some guidance, flyer to support the understanding of targetted CSO are produced. They are guidance for environment and management quality as well as leadership for female workers.

title.narrative: Corporates implement sustainability policies (OUTPUT)
# and kind private sector partners engaged to co-design, test and promote new tools and business models for sourcing, production, trade and investment

comment.narrative: Year 1 focused on developing the media/tool.

title.narrative: Corporates and financial institutes implement sustainability policies

# and qualitative description of innovative and inclusive solutions / recommendations that are submitted by civil society through inclusive dialogues to key public and private sector decision makers for adoption and implementation

comment.narrative: Year 1 is focused on policy mapping and to strengthen and raise awareness- improve knowledge and information of relevant stakeholders

title.narrative: Corporates implement sustainability policies (OUTPUT)
# of farmers, miners and workers using the developed tools and business models being tested for sourcing, production, trade and investment

comment.narrative: Year 1, is stage to process developing tool or media to support better understanding of women workers related to workplaces, and skill needed.
